definition: secure as a city protected by a wall of metal and a moat of boiling water (idiom)/well fortified/invulnerable to attack
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled

sentences.english: Do pair of hackers trade on stockjobber net with respect to impregnable ?
sentences.chinese: 证券公司网上交易对黑客就固若金汤？

sentences.english: The old Dutch fort with its thick high walls looks virtually impregnable.
sentences.chinese: 古老的荷兰城堡城墙又厚又高，看起来几乎固若金汤。

sentences.english: The submarine is invulnerable to attack while at sea.
sentences.chinese: 潜艇固若金汤，海上攻击打不倒。

definition: copper wall, iron bastion (idiom); impenetrable defense
to make a breakthrough/to break through/to breach (military)
(of troops stationed in a strategic area) to defend/(fig.) to stand guard/to protect
solid as a boulder (idiom); absolutely secure/rock-firm and unyielding
as solid as rock (idiom); as sure as houses
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
